TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridViewComboBoxCell extends System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell

Docs.summary: Displays a combo box in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> class is a specialized type of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> used to display a combo box control, which is an editing field combined with a list selection field. The currently selected <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> hosts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxEditingControl> in which the user can change the cell's value, assuming the cell's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ReadOnly%2A> property is set to `false`.
Unlike the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> does not have <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> properties. Instead, selecting a value from a drop-down list sets the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Value%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> is the column type specialized to hold cells of this type. By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.CellTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is initialized to a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell>. To pattern the cells within a column after an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell>, set the column's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.CellTemplate%2A> property to the cell to use as a pattern.
The cell-related properties of the column are wrappers for the similarly-named properties of the template cell. Changing the property values of the template cell will affect only cells based on the template that are added after the change. Changing the cell-related property values of the column, however, will update the template cell and all other cells in the column, and refresh the column display if necessary.
You will typically work with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> type unless you want to override column values for specific cells. The guidelines described in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic for populating the drop-down list applies to both cell and column instances.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class, which makes use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> class. You can set the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> properties in the same way that the corresponding column properties are set in this example. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CPP/employees.cpp#40)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CS/employees.cs#40)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/VB/employees.vb#40)]

block.para: When you derive from and add new properties to the derived class, be sure to override the method to copy the new properties during cloning operations. You should also call the base class's method so that the properties of the base class are copied to the new cell.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object DataSource { get; set; }
.property instance object DataSource

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data source whose data contains the possible selections shown in the drop-down list.
Docs.value: An or that contains a collection of values used to supply data to the drop-down list. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically this property will be set for an entire column of cells through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.DataSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
If possible, set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> to a source containing only the possible selections, like a column of selections. Then the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> property doesn't need to be set. But if the source is more complicated, set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> to the name of the property or column from which to retrieve possible selections.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> is set to a string array, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> do not need to be set because each string in the array will be used for both value and display.
Changing the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> property causes the cell to reinitialize its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> collection and redraw itself.
When you change the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> property, the control attempts to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> property values with the new data source, and sets each property to `null` if its value cannot be found. Any exception that occurs during this process is ignored unless it is one of the following critical exceptions: <xref:System.NullReferenceException>, <xref:System.StackOverflowException>, <xref:System.OutOfMemoryException>, <xref:System.Threading.ThreadAbortException>, <xref:System.ExecutionEngineException>, <xref:System.IndexOutOfRangeException>, or <xref:System.AccessViolationException>.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> is set, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> attaches to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.Disposed> event of the data source. When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> is detached from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>, the resource is not immediately released. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> resource is released when the attached data source is disposed. To release the resource for garbage collection immediately, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> property to `null`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.DataSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CPP/employees.cpp#40)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CS/employees.cs#40)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/VB/employees.vb#40)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string DisplayMember { get; set; }
.property instance string DisplayMember

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string that specifies where to gather selections to display in the drop-down list.
Docs.value: A string specifying the name of a property or column in the data source specified in the property. The default value is , which indicates that the property will not be used.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> represents the text information displayed in the combo box drop-down list. In contrast, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> property represents the corresponding value of a selection.
If the data for the selections displayed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> is supposed to be drawn from a nondefault property or column of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A>, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> must be set in addition to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A>.
When <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> is set to a string array, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> does not need to be set because each string in the array will be used as a valid display string and a valid underlying value.
Another way of loading combo box selections is to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> property. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> must contain the property name from which to gather the selections.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.DisplayMember%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CPP/employees.cpp#40)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CS/employees.cs#40)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/VB/employees.vb#40)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxDisplayStyle DisplayStyle { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxDisplayStyle DisplayStyle

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how the combo box is displayed when it is not in edit mode.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property affects the appearance of the cell when it is not in edit mode, and regardless of whether it is read-only. When the cell is in edit mode, it always looks like a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyleForCurrentCellOnly%2A> property value is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property affects the cell only when it is the current cell.
The behavior and appearance of the drop-down arrow is indicated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FlatStyle%2A> property.
To enable cell highlighting when the mouse pointer is over the cell, you must set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxDisplayStyle.ComboBox> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FlatStyle%2A> property value to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle.Popup>.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.DisplayStyle%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

Docs.exception: The specified value when setting this property is not a valid value.

.property instance bool DisplayStyleForCurrentCellOnly

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property affects the appearance of the cell when it is not in edit mode, and regardless of whether it is read-only. When the cell is in edit mode, it always looks like a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control.

.property instance valuetype System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle FlatStyle

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the flat style appearance of the cell.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FlatStyle%2A> property affects the behavior and appearance of the drop-down arrow in the cell.
To enable cell highlighting when the mouse pointer is over the cell, you must set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxDisplayStyle.ComboBox> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FlatStyle%2A> property value to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle.Popup>.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.FlatStyle%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FlatStyle%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display. To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.FlatStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CPP/employees.cpp#40)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CS/employees.cs#40)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/VB/employees.vb#40)]

.property instance class System.Type FormattedValueType

Docs.summary: Gets the class type of the formatted value associated with the cell.
Docs.value: The type of the cell's formatted value. This property always returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because a combo box only handles text information, the type of the underlying formatted value is always <xref:System.String>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValueType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine the type of the cell contents. In this example, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValueType%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is used to determine whether the cell contains a <xref:System.String> before attempting to convert the value. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectionChanged?displayProperty=fullName> event.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override object GetFormattedValue (object value, int rowIndex, ref System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle cellStyle, System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter valueTypeConverter, System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter formattedValueTypeConverter, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts context);

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance object GetFormattedValue(object value, int32 rowIndex, class System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle cellStyle, class System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter valueTypeConverter, class System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter formattedValueTypeConverter, valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts context) cil managed

Docs.param: The value to be formatted.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The in effect for the cell.
A associated with the value type that provides custom conversion to the formatted value type, or if no such custom conversion is needed.
A associated with the formatted value type that provides custom conversion from the value type, or if no such custom conversion is needed.
A bitwise combination of values describing the context in which the formatted value is needed.
Docs.summary: Gets the formatted value of the cell's data.
Docs.returns: The value of the cell's data after formatting has been applied or if the cell is not part of a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control calls this method to convert a cell value into an equivalent display value of the type indicated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FormattedValueType%2A> property. The control passes the cell value to this method in the `value` parameter.
This method first determines whether `value` is valid by determining whether one of the following conditions is met.
- `value` is present in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> collection.
- `value` is `null` or <xref:System.DBNull.Value?displayProperty=fullName>.
- `value` is <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueType%2A> property value represents the <xref:System.String> type.
If `value` is not valid, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError?displayProperty=fullName> event occurs. If there is no handler for this event or the handler sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.ThrowException%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `true`, an exception is thrown.
If `value` is valid or there is a handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError> event and it does not set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.ThrowException%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellFormatting?displayProperty=fullName> event occurs.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellFormatting> event handler can modify both `value` and `cellStyle`. If the handler does not set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellFormattingEventArgs.FormattingApplied%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `true`, however, this method formats `value` using the formatting properties of the `cellStyle` object. This can result in an additional <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError> event.
If formatting is successful, this method returns the formatted value for display in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.

Docs.exception: Formatting failed and either there is no handler for the event of the control or the handler set the property to . The exception object can typically be cast to type for type conversion errors or to type if cannot be found in the or the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void InitializeEditingControl (int rowIndex, object initialFormattedValue, System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle dataGridViewCellStyle);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void InitializeEditingControl(int32 rowIndex, object initialFormattedValue, class System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle dataGridViewCellStyle) cil managed

Docs.param: The index of the cell's parent row.
The initial value to be displayed in the control.
A that determines the appearance of the hosted control.
Docs.summary: Attaches and initializes the hosted editing control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.InitializeEditingControl%2A> method initializes the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control as described in the base <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.InitializeEditingControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. In addition, for every invocation, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.InitializeEditingControl%2A> does the following:
- Sets the visual properties of the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.MaxDropDownItems%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.DropDownWidth%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.FlatStyle%2A>, to match the corresponding properties of the current cell.
- Sets the data-bound properties of the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A>, to match the corresponding properties of the current cell.
- Reinitializes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.Items%2A> property of the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control.
This method also adjusts the cell's dimensions to accommodate the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ObjectCollection Items { get; }
.property instance class System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell/ObjectCollection Items

Docs.summary: Gets the objects that represent the selection displayed in the drop-down list.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property enables you to obtain a reference to the list of items that are currently stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell>. With this reference, you can add items, remove items, and obtain a count of the items in the collection. For more information on the tasks that can be performed with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> collection, see <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ObjectCollection>.
If strings are added to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A>, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> do not need to be set because each string added will be used for both value and display.
> [!NOTE] > <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> does not support the use of multiple items with identical display values.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> property is set, then the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> property cannot be used.
The formatted value of the cell must always be one of the values in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> collection or an error will occur and the cell value will revert to the first item in the collection. You can customize this behavior by handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellFormatting?displayProperty=fullName> events.
Setting this property to a value other than the value of the parent column's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.Items%2A> property will force the row to become unshared, allocating extra memory. For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.Items%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#30](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CPP/employees.cpp#30)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#30](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CS/employees.cs#30)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#30](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/VB/employees.vb#30)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool KeyEntersEditMode (System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs e);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool KeyEntersEditMode(class System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A that represents the key that was pressed.
Docs.summary: Determines if edit mode should be started based on the given key.
Docs.returns: if edit mode should be started; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EditMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditMode.EditOnKeystroke> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditMode.EditOnKeystrokeOrF2>, the control uses this method to determine whether a key other than F2 that is pressed by the user while this cell has focus will cause the cell to enter edit mode.
This method returns `true` if the e parameter indicates one of the following keys or key combinations: F4, ALT+UP ARROW, ALT+DOWN ARROW, or an ordinary data-entry key (such as a letter, number, punctuation mark, or the SPACE key) unmodified by ALT or CTRL, excluding SHIFT+SPACE, which is used by the control for selection purposes. For more information, see [Default Keyboard and Mouse Handling in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/default-keyboard-and-mouse-handling-in-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int MaxDropDownItems { get; set; }
.property instance int32 MaxDropDownItems

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of items shown in the drop-down list.
Docs.value: The number of drop-down list items to allow. The minimum is 1 and the maximum is 100; the default is 8.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Changing the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.MaxDropDownItems%2A> property changes the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.MaxDropDownItems%2A> property of the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxEditingControl>, if one exits.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.MaxDropDownItems%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#30](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CPP/employees.cpp#30)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#30](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CS/employees.cs#30)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#30](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/VB/employees.vb#30)]

Docs.exception: The value is less than 1 or greater than 100 when setting this property.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Sorted { get; set; }
.property instance bool Sorted

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the items in the combo box are automatically sorted.
Docs.value: if the combo box is sorted; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property specifies whether the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxEditingControl> sorts existing entries and add new entries to the appropriate sorted position in the list. When this property is set to `false`, new items are added to the end of the existing list. The sorting operation is case-insensitive and performed in alphabetically ascending order.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.Sorted%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#30](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CPP/employees.cpp#30)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#30](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CS/employees.cs#30)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#30](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/VB/employees.vb#30)]

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to sort a cell that is attached to a data source.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ValueMember { get; set; }
.property instance string ValueMember

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a string that specifies where to gather the underlying values used in the drop-down list.
Docs.value: A string specifying the name of a property or column. The default value is , which indicates that this property is ignored.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> represents the corresponding value of a selection. In contrast, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> property represents the text information displayed in the drop-down list.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> property specifies the data source for the value of the selections displayed in the drop-down list.
If the data for the selections displayed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> is supposed to be drawn from a nondefault property or column of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A>, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> must be set in addition to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A>.
When <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> is set to a string array, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> does not need to be set because each string in the array will be used as a valid display string and a valid underlying value.
Another way of loading combo box selections is to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> property. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> must contain the property name from which to gather the selections.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.ValueMember%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which is similar to this property. This example is part of a larger example available in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CPP/employees.cpp#40)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/CS/employees.cs#40)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees#40](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumn_AllColumns_Bound_Employees/VB/employees.vb#40)]

Docs.exception: The property is not and the specified value when setting this property is not or and does not name a valid property or column in the data source.
